bill.title: Public purchasing laws; revise methods used to let certain contracts.
bill.description: An Act To Revise The Provisions That Govern Any Procurements Contracted For By Each State Agency Or Governing Authority; To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Adopt Any Necessary Rules And Regulations To Implement This Act; To Provide Definitions; To Provide That All Purchasing Agency Contracts Shall Be Awarded By Competitive Sealed Bidding, Competitive Sealed Proposals, Small Purchases, Sole Source Procurement, Emergency Procurements Or Architectural And Engineering Services; To Provide Explanations Of Each Of The Methods Of Procurement; To Provide That Design-bid-build, Operations And Maintenance, Design-build, Design-build-operate-maintain And Design-build-finance-operate-maintain Methods Project Delivery Methods Shall Be Authorized For Procurements Relating To The Design, Construction, Routine Operation, Routine Repair And Routine Maintenance Of Infrastructure Facilities And Services; To Bring Forward Sections 25-9-120, 31-7-7, 31-7-9, 31-7-10, 31-7-11, 31-7-12, 31-7-13.1, 31-7-13.2, 31-7-14, 31-7-15, 31-7-21, 31-7-23, 31-7-47, 31-7-49, 31-7-55, 31-7-57, 31-7-73, 31-7-101, 31-7-103, 31-7-105, 31-7-107, 31-7-115, 31-7-119, 31-7-303, 31-7-305, 25-15-11, 25-53-5, 37-39-17, 37-41-101, 63-11-47, 65-1-85 And 93-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Sections 31-7-1, 31-7-13, 31-7-14.1, 31-7-18 And 45-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Some Minor, Nonsubstantive Changes; And For Related Purposes.
